english: (chess) to move the pawn forward; (60-70's) to cross the border and enter Hong Kong illegally
notes: A river divides the sides in Chinese Chess. A pawn can only move forward on its own side, but would acquire the ability to move sideways as well after crossing the river. Shenzhen River runs between mainland China and Hong Kong. To escape political repression and economic hardship during the 60/70's, tens of thousands young Cantonese swam across the river to HK. Just like the pawns, one's full potential could be realized after crossing the river.
